column4: anyone know how to download a .run file from a website that won't let you 'save-as' ?  it just opens inside the browser
> something to tweak in your browser's preferences
do you know what browser settings to tweak?  I'm using firefox?
> in FF 1.5 : Edit > Preferences > Downloads > View & Edit Actions
I'm still trying to locate that preference setting but I don't see it...
> which FF version do you run ?
1.07.  i see "change action" but it is greyed out. i can edit the plugin behavior but i can't tell it "do this to this type of file"

it's on my to-do list.  But there must be a way to download a .run file from a website like that. I can't imagine that no linux user has ever downloaded .run files from a website like that before me...
thanks for the help and i'm not trying to be a smart-ass...
I guess i could try opera, but i've never had any other reason to switch away from firefox
seems like a very round-about work-around.
> but you vould have opera, just to use in such cases
I upgraded firefox to 1.5 but that settings section you are talking about actually doesn't let you add or customize filetypes. it lets you change how existing behaviors work
